title: Augusta County: Tony Pastor to Annie Harris, July 25, 1861
summary: Pastor begins by describing a very hard march to a position in the Piedmont, then describes the Battle of Bull Run in some detail. He expresses patriotic sentiment in the early part of the letter but describes horror at reviewing the wounded and dead on the field after the battle. He also refers to the Union troops as rebels.
